English Sentences: From the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zacharias, which perished between the altar and the temple: verily I say unto you, It shall be required of this generation.
Wolaitta Sentences: ee, ha wodiyaa asai qaxxayettanau bessees gais.

English Sentences: Woe unto you, lawyers! for ye have taken away the key of knowledge: ye entered not in yourselves, and them that were entering in ye hindered.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageetoo, eraa keettaa dooyiya qulppiyaa intte ekkideta; intte huuphiyaunne gelibeekketa; qassi gelanau koyiyaageetanne gelissekketa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And as he said these things unto them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to urge him vehemently, and to provoke him to speak of many things:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi hegaappe biido wode, higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageetinne Parisaaweti a daro ixuwaa doommidi,

English Sentences: Laying wait for him, and seeking to catch something out of his mouth, that they might accuse him.
Wolaitta Sentences: i balabaa haasayikko oiqqanau naagiiddi, daro yohuwaa keehi oichchidosona.

English Sentences: In the mean time, when there were gathered together an innumerable multitude of people, insomuch that they trode one upon another, he began to say unto his disciples first of all, Beware ye of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode daro sha7u asai issoi issuwaa yedhdhana gakkanaashin shiiqi uttidaashin, Yesuusi erissiyo ashkkaratussi koiroora odanau doommidi, "Parisaawetu irshshuwaappe naagettite; hegeenne, lo77o misatiya iitatettaappe naagettite giyoogaa.

English Sentences: For there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; neither hid, that shall not be known.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin aibinne gentti wottidobai qoncciyaa kiyennan attenna; qassi qotti wottidobaikka erettennan attenna.

English Sentences: Therefore whatsoever ye have spoken in darkness shall be heard in the light; and that which ye have spoken in the ear in closets shall be proclaimed upon the housetops.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, intte xuman haasayidobai ubbai gallassi poo7uwan siyettana; intte asi bainnasan haittan saasukkidi odidobai ubbai keettaa huuphiyan awaajettana.

English Sentences: And I say unto you my friends, Be not afraid of them that kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta ishatoo, taani intteyyo odais; ha77i ashuwaa woridi, guyyeppe ainne hegaappe aadhdhiyaabaa oottanau danddayennaageetau yayyoppite.

English Sentences: But I will forewarn you whom ye shall fear: Fear him, which after he hath killed hath power to cast into hell; yea, I say unto you, Fear him.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin intte oossi yayyanaakko, taani inttena erissana; woridoogaappe guyyiyan, Gaannabiyan olanau wolqqai de7iyoogaassi yayyite; ee assi yayyite gais.

English Sentences: Are not five sparrows sold for two farthings, and not one of them is forgotten before God?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ichchashu siine kafoti santtimiyan baizettokkonaayye? Etappe issinnonne Xoossai dogenna.

English Sentences: But even the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Fear not therefore: ye are of more value than many sparrows.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin harai atto intte huuphiyan de7iya binnaana ubbaikka qoodan de7ees; simmi yayyoppite; daro siine kafotuppe intte aadhdheeta.

English Sentences: Also I say unto you, Whosoever shall confess me before men, him shall the Son of man also confess before the angels of God:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani intteyyo odais; tabaa asa sinttan markkattiya ooyyookka taanikka Asa Na7ai, qassi Xoossaa kiitanchchatu sinttan markkattana;

English Sentences: But he that denieth me before men shall be denied before the angels of God.
Wolaitta Sentences: shin asa sinttan tana kaddiyaagaa taanikka Asa Na7ai, qassi Xoossaa kiitanchchatu sinttan a kaddana.

English Sentences: And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Ghost it shall not be forgiven.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta bolli, Asa Na7aa bolli, iitabaa haasayiya ubbaa nagarai atto geetettana; shin Geeshsha Ayyaanaa cayiya uraa nagarai atto geetettenna.

English Sentences: And when they bring you unto the synagogues, and unto magistrates, and powers, take ye no thought how or what thing ye shall answer, or what ye shall say:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Inttena Aihuda woosa keettatukko, daannatukkonne deriyaa haariyaageetukko ehiyo wode, Waatidi zaaranee? Woi woigidi haasayanee? yaagidi hirggoppite;

English Sentences: For the Holy Ghost shall teach you in the same hour what ye ought to say.
Wolaitta Sentences: aissi giikko, intte he wode gaanau bessiyaabaa inttena Geeshsha Ayyaanai tamaarissana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And one of the company said unto him, Master, speak to my brother, that he divide the inheritance with me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daro asaappe issoi a, "Tamaarissiyaagoo, ta aawai aggidi haiqqido aquwaa ta ishai tanaara shaakkana mala, ayyo yoota" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said unto him, Man, who made me a judge or a divider over you?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yesuusi, "Bitaniyau, tana intte bolli pirddiya daanna woi hegaa inttessi shaakkiyaagaa oottidi sunttidai oonee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said unto them, Take heed, and beware of covetousness: for a man's life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi eta, "Asassi daro miishshai de7ikkokka, a shemppoi he duretettan de7enna gishshau naagettite; duretetta amo ubbaappekka inttena naagite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he spake a parable unto them, saying, The ground of a certain rich man brought forth plentifully:
Wolaitta Sentences: Etassi leemisuwaa odiiddi, "Issi dure bitaniyaa biittai daro mokkees.

English Sentences: And he thought within himself, saying, What shall I do, because I have no room where to bestow my fruits?
Wolaitta Sentences: Bitanee, Taassi ta kattaa wottiyo sohoi bainna gishshau waatooshsha yaagidi, ba wozanan qoppiis;

English Sentences: And he said, This will I do: I will pull down my barns, and build greater; and there will I bestow all my fruits and my goods.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani waatanee giikko, ta gootaraa qolada, hara gitatiyaagaa gootarana; ta kattaanne tabaa ubbaa hegan wottana.

English Sentences: And I will say to my soul, Soul, thou hast much goods laid up for many years; take thine ease, eat, drink, and be merry.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatada tana, "Laa tanooshsho, neessi daro laittaassi gidiya daro miishshai de7ees; shemppa, ma, uya, ufaitta" gaana yaagiis.

English Sentences: But God said unto him, Thou fool, this night thy soul shall be required of thee: then whose shall those things be, which thou hast provided?
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHin Xoossai a, Laa ha eeyyau, neeni hachchi qamma haiqqaasa; yaatin, ha neeni shiishshidobai oossi gidanee? yaagiis.

English Sentences: So is he that layeth up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossaa matan dure gidennan, bau miishsha shiishshiyai ooninne he bitaniyaa mala" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said unto his disciples, Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat; neither for the body, what ye shall put on.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi erissiyo ashkkarata, "Hegaa gishshau, taani intteyyo odais; intte paxa de7anau maanabaassinne woi intte bollau maayanabaassi hirggoppite.

English Sentences: The life is more than meat, and the body is more than raiment.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, shemppoi qumappe aadhdhennee? Qassi bollai maayoppe aadhdhennee?

English Sentences: Consider the ravens: for they neither sow nor reap; which neither have storehouse nor barn; and God feedeth them: how much more are ye better than the fowls?
Wolaitta Sentences: Qooraaseta xeellite; eti zerokkona; cakkokkona; etau minjjiyo keetti woi gootari baawa; eta Xoossai mizees; kafotuppe intte keehi aadhdheeta.

English Sentences: And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit?
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte giddon daro qoppidi, ba geesaa bolli issi wara gujjanau danddayiyai oonee?

English Sentences: If ye then be not able to do that thing which is least, why take ye thought for the rest?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin intte hegaa mala, guuttabaa oottanau danddayennaageeti aissi harabau hirggeetii?

English Sentences: Consider the lilies how they grow: they toil not, they spin not; and yet I say unto you, that Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ciishshati waani dicciyaakko xeellite; daafurokkona woi puutto suqqokkona. SHin taani intteyyo odais; harai atto, Solomoni hegaa keena bonchchettidaagaa gidiiddi, he ciishshatuppe issuwaagaa malaa maayibeenna.

English Sentences: If then God so clothe the grass, which is to day in the field, and to morrow is cast into the oven; how much more will he clothe you, O ye of little faith?
Wolaitta Sentences: Laafa ammanoi de7iyoogeetoo, Xoossai hachchi de7idi, wontto coociyaa taman eexxiya dembbaa maataa maizziyaagee, inttena etaagaappe aattidi, waati maizzennee?

English Sentences: And seek not ye what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink, neither be ye of doubtful mind.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Intte maanabaanne uyanabaa darissidi koyoppitenne qassi hirggoppite.

English Sentences: For all these things do the nations of the world seek after: and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, ha sa7an de7iya ammanenna asati he ubbabaa darissidi koyoosona; qassi he ubbai inttena koshshiyoogaa intte Aawai erees.

English Sentences: But rather seek ye the kingdom of God; and all these things shall be added unto you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa aggi bayidi, Xoossaa kawotettaa koyite; i hegeeta inttessi immana.

English Sentences: Fear not, little flock; for it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Amarida dorssa wudiyau, intte Aawai ba kawotettaa inttessi immanau ufaittiyo gishshau yayyoppite.

English Sentences: Sell that ye have, and give alms; provide yourselves bags which wax not old, a treasure in the heavens that faileth not, where no thief approacheth, neither moth corrupteth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Inttessi de7iyaabaa baizzite; hiyyeesau immite; kaisoi shiiqennasan, bil77ai bochchennasan, saluwan wurenna miishshaa dagayidi, ceeggenna korjjuwaa intte huuphessi oottite.

English Sentences: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, intte wozanai intte miishshai de7iyoosan de7ana.

English Sentences: Let your loins be girded about, and your lights burning;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Bantta godai bullachchaappe soo simmidi, kariyaa dooyanau xeegiyo wode, sohuwaara dooyanau naagiya asatudan,

English Sentences: And ye yourselves like unto men that wait for their lord, when he will return from the wedding; that when he cometh and knocketh, they may open unto him immediately.
Wolaitta Sentences: intte xeessan qabattuwaa mintti gixxidi, xomppiyaa xomppidi, giigi uttite.

English Sentences: Blessed are those servants, whom the lord when he cometh shall find watching: verily I say unto you, that he shall gird himself, and make them to sit down to meat, and will come forth and serve them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bantta godai soo yiyo wode, xiskkennan naagiiddi uttida ashkkarati waani anjjettanddonaashsha! Taani tumaa gais; i eta, Uttite giidi, ba qabattuwaa minttidi, eta sinttau qumaa aattana.

English Sentences: And if he shall come in the second watch, or come in the third watch, and find them so, blessed are those servants.
Wolaitta Sentences: Omarssa gidin, woi qamma bilahe gidin, audenne eta godai yiidi, eta giigi uttidaageeta be7ikko, eti waani anjjettanddonaashsha!

English Sentences: And this know, that if the goodman of the house had known what hour the thief would come, he would have watched, and not have suffered his house to be broken through.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin intte issibaa erite; hegeenne aibee giikko, kaisoi yaana wodiyaa keettaawai eridaakko, beegottidi kaisuwan ba keettaa bookissenna.

English Sentences: Be ye therefore ready also: for the Son of man cometh at an hour when ye think not.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani, Asa Na7ai, intte qoppenna wodiyan yaana gishshau, inttekka qassi giigi uttanau bessees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Peter said unto him, Lord, speakest thou this parable unto us, or even to all?
Wolaitta Sentences: PHeexiroosi a, "Godau, neeni ha leemisuwaa nuussi odaiyye ubbaassi odai?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the Lord said, Who then is that faithful and wise steward, whom his lord shall make ruler over his household, to give them their portion of meat in due season?
Wolaitta Sentences: Godai zaaridi yaagiis; "Yaatin ba so asau qumaa koshshiyo wodiyan immana mala, a godai sunttiyo ammanettiya wozannaama ashkkari oonee?

English Sentences: Blessed is that servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.
Wolaitta Sentences: I hegaadan oottishin, a godai yiidi, demmiyo ashkkarai anjjettidaagaa.

English Sentences: Of a truth I say unto you, that he will make him ruler over all that he hath.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani intteyyo tumaa odais; godai he ashkkaraa babaa ubbaa bolli sunttana.

English Sentences: But and if that servant say in his heart, My lord delayeth his coming; and shall begin to beat the menservants and maidens, and to eat and drink, and to be drunken;
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin he ashkkarai, Ta godai gam77idi yaana yaagidi, ba wozanan qoppidi, hara ashkkarata, attumaageetanne maccaageeta deshettaa doommikko, qassi meettaanne ushshaa doommikkonne mattottikko,

English Sentences: The lord of that servant will come in a day when he looketh not for him, and at an hour when he is not aware, and will cut him in sunder, and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers.
Wolaitta Sentences: he ashkkaraa godai i qoppibeenna gallassaaninne qassi i eribeenna saatiyan yaana. Yiidi a qanxxerettidi, ammanettenna asai de7iyoosan wottana.

English Sentences: And that servant, which knew his lord's will, and prepared not himself, neither did according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ba godai dosiyoobaa eriiddi giigettibeenna ashkkarai, woi i dosiyoogaadan oottennan ixxida ashkkarai, lissuwan daro garafettana.

English Sentences: But he that knew not, and did commit things worthy of stripes, shall be beaten with few stripes. For unto whomsoever much is given, of him shall be much required: and to whom men have committed much, of him they will ask the more.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ba godai dosiyoobaa erennan lissuwan garafanau bessiyaabaa oottida ashkkarai lissuwan guuttaa garafettana. Daruwaa immido uraappe daroi koyettees. Appekka dariyaagaa immido uraappe keehi daroi koyettees.

English Sentences: I am come to send fire on the earth; and what will I, if it be already kindled?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani taman sa7aa oittanau yaas; ha77ikka xuugettappe harabaa ainne koyikke.

English Sentences: But I have a baptism to be baptized with; and how am I straitened till it be accomplished!
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani xammaqettana xinqqatiyaa de7ausu; he xinqqatiyaa polettanaashin, taani waana tuggataneeshsha!

English Sentences: Suppose ye that I am come to give peace on earth? I tell you, Nay; but rather division:
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani sa7aassi sarotettaa ehaanau yiidabaa inttessi milatii? CHii, chii, taani intteyyo odais; taani asaa gidduwan shaahotettaa medhdhanau yiidoogaappe attin.

English Sentences: For from henceforth there shall be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, hagaappe sinttan issi keettan ichchashu asati de7ana; de7ishin heezzai naa77aa bolli, naa77ai heezzaa bolli denddidi, shaahettana.

English Sentences: The father shall be divided against the son, and the son against the father; the mother against the daughter, and the daughter against the mother; the mother in law against her daughter in law, and the daughter in law against her mother in law.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aawai ba na7aa bolli, na7ai ba aawaa bolli, aayyiyaa ba na7ee bolli, na7iyaa ba aayee bolli, bollotiyaa ba na7aa machchee bolli, na7aa machchiyaa ba bollotee bolli, denddidi shaahettana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said also to the people, When ye see a cloud rise out of the west, straightway ye say, There cometh a shower; and so it is.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi qassi asaa, "Awai wulliyo baggaara kiyiya shaaraa intte be7iyo wode, sohuwaara, Wolqqaama irai yees yaageeta; tumakka yees.

English Sentences: And when ye see the south wind blow, ye say, There will be heat; and it cometh to pass.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tohossa baggaara carkkoi carkkiyo wode, Hombbana hanees yaageeta; tumakka hombbees.

English Sentences: Ye hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky and of the earth; but how is it that ye do not discern this time?
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte lo77o misatiya iitati, sa7aanne saluwaa xeellidi, hananabaa eriiddi, ha wodiyaabaa aissi erekketii?

English Sentences: Yea, and why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yaatin aissi intte intte huuphiyan xilluwaa pirddekketii?

English Sentences: When thou goest with thine adversary to the magistrate, as thou art in the way, give diligence that thou mayest be delivered from him; lest he hale thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and the officer cast thee into prison.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nena pirdda keettan mootiyaagee daanna sintti goochchenna mala, qassi daannai nena polisiyau aattidi immenna mala, poliseekka qasho keettaa gelissenna mala, nena mootiyaagaara pirdda keettaa baidda, ogiyan sigettaichcha.

English Sentences: I tell thee, thou shalt not depart thence, till thou hast paid the very last mite.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani neeyyo odais; neeni issi santtimee attennan, ne maqqaccuwaa wurssada qanxxana gakkanaassi, mulekka qasho keettaappe kiyakka" yaagiis.

English Sentences: There were present at that season some that told him of the Galilaeans, whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi issi asai he wode yiidi, Galiila asatubaa Yesuusassi odiiddi, "PHilaaxoosi Galiila asata woridi, eta suuttaa eti yarshshiyoobaara walakkiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jesus answering said unto them, Suppose ye that these Galilaeans were sinners above all the Galilaeans, because they suffered such things?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi zaaridi, hagaadan yaagiis; "Ha Galiila asati haiqqido gishshau, yaatin inttessi hara Galiila asa ubbaappekka nagaranchcha milatiyoonaa?

English Sentences: I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.
Wolaitta Sentences: CHii, eti gidennaagaa taani inttessi odais; shin intte nagaraappe simmennan ixxikko, intte ubbaikka hegaadan haiqqana.

English Sentences: Or those eighteen, upon whom the tower in Siloam fell, and slew them, think ye that they were sinners above all men that dwelt in Jerusalem?
Wolaitta Sentences: Woikko Saliihoomen shuchchan keexxido adussa keettai eta bolli kunddidi, worido tammanne hosppun asati Yerusalaamen de7iya ubbaappe daro naaqqidaageeta inttessi milatiyoonaa?

English Sentences: I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.
Wolaitta Sentences: CHii, eti naaqqibeennaagaa taani inttessi odais; nagaraappe simmennan ixxikko, intte ubbai hegaadan haiqqana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: He spake also this parable; A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard; and he came and sought fruit thereon, and found none.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi Yesuusi ha leemisuwaa etassi odiis; "Hagee augee giikko, issi bitaniyaassi woiniyaa turaa giddon tokettida balasiyo giyo mittiyaa de7ausu. He bitanee mittiyaa aifidaakkonne giidi yin, aifee i bolli xayiis.

English Sentences: Then said he unto the dresser of his vineyard, Behold, these three years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree, and find none: cut it down; why cumbereth it the ground?
Wolaitta Sentences: Woiniyaa turaa oottiyaagaa i, Taani ha balaseeppe aife demmana yaagaidda, heezzu laitta gakkanaashinkka ya yaada ainne demmabeikke. He balasiyaa aissi gaden coo eqqa bayadee? Qanxxa ola yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he answering said unto him, Lord, let it alone this year also, till I shall dig about it, and dung it:
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin woiniyaa turaa oottiyaagee zaaridi, Godau, taani o bul77ada i xaphuwan oshaa yegganaashin, ha laittikka agga baya.

English Sentences: And if it bear fruit, well: and if not, then after that thou shalt cut it down.
Wolaitta Sentences: Laitti a aifikko lo77o; shin aifennan ixxikko qanxxettu giis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbath.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi Sambbatan Yesuusi Aihuda woosa keettatuppe issuwan tamaarissees.

English Sentences: And, behold, there was a woman which had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and was bowed together, and could in no wise lift up herself.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tammanne hosppun laittaasappe doommada, i bolli iita ayyaanai de7iyaagee harggissin, sahettada de7iya issi mishiriyaa de7ausu. Quuna gididaara muleera sitti gaada eqqanau danddayabeikku.

English Sentences: And when Jesus saw her, he called her to him, and said unto her, Woman, thou art loosed from thine infirmity.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi o be7ido wode, "Maccaasee, ne harggiyaappe paxadasa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he laid his hands on her: and immediately she was made straight, and glorified God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba kushiyaa i bolli wottin, sohuwaara sitti ga eqqada Xoossaa galataasu.

English Sentences: And the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation, because that Jesus had healed on the sabbath day, and said unto the people, There are six days in which men ought to work: in them therefore come and be healed, and not on the sabbath day.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Aihuda woosa keettaa halaqai Yesuusi Sambbata gallassan harggiyaappe mishiriyo pattido gishshau hanqqettidi asaa, "Ooso oottiyo gallassati usuppuna; intte yiidi harggiyaappe paxanau bessiyoi he gallassatuunappe attin, Sambbataana gidenna" yaagiis.

English Sentences: The Lord then answered him, and said, Thou hypocrite, doth not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox or his ass from the stall, and lead him away to watering?
Wolaitta Sentences: Godai zaaridi, "Ha lo77o milatiya iita asatoo, intteppe issoinne Sambbatan booraa woi hariyaa gaaxaataappe birshshidi, haattaa ushshanau efeennee?

English Sentences: And ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan hath bound, lo, these eighteen years, be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hanna Abrahaama zariyaa tammanne hosppun laittaasappe Seexaanai qachchidoora qashuwaappe Sambbatan birshshettanau bessekkee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when he had said these things, all his adversaries were ashamed: and all the people rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him.
Wolaitta Sentences: I immiyo zaaroi a morkketa yeellayiis; i oottido ooratta yoho ubban asai ubbai ufaittiis.

English Sentences: Then said he, Unto what is the kingdom of God like? and whereunto shall I resemble it?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi, "Xoossaa kawotettai ai milatii? I ai milatiyaakko, taani inttena waata bessoo?

English Sentences: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and cast into his garden; and it grew, and waxed a great tree; and the fowls of the air lodged in the branches of it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa kawotettai sanaafici giyo qii mittee aifiyo milatees. He mittee aifiyo asai ekkidi zeriis; zerin mokkidaara diccada gita mitta gidaasu; gidin kafoi i tashiyaa bolli baassi keexxiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And again he said, Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God?
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassikka Yesuusi, "Xoossaa kawotettai ai milatiyaakko, taani inttena waatada bessoo?

English Sentences: It is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal, till the whole was leavened.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi mishiriyaa heezzu kere xiilliyaa ekkada, munaqqido munaqai ubbai denddana gakkanaassi, aani tigido irshshuwaa milatees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he went through the cities and villages, teaching, and journeying toward Jerusalem.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yerusalaame biiddi, gita katamaaninne qeeri kataman de7iya asaa tamaarissiiddi aadhdhees.

English Sentences: Then said one unto him, Lord, are there few that be saved? And he said unto them,
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhishin issi bitanee a, "Ta Godau neeni ashshanaageeti amaridaageetee?" yaagiis. Yaagin Yesuusi eta,

English Sentences: Strive to enter in at the strait gate: for many, I say unto you, will seek to enter in, and shall not be able.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani intteyyo odais; daro asai gelanau koyana shin danddayenna gishshau, un77o penggiyaara gelanau olettite.

English Sentences: When once the master of the house is risen up, and hath shut to the door, and ye begin to stand without, and to knock at the door, saying, Lord, Lord, open unto us; and he shall answer and say unto you, I know you not whence ye are:
Wolaitta Sentences: Keettaawai denddidi, ba keettaa gorddirggin, karen intte eqqidi, Godau, godau, nuussi dooyarkkii yaagidi xeessaa doommiyo wode, i zaaridi, Intte awappe yiyaakko, taani inttena erikke yaagana.

English Sentences: Then shall ye begin to say, We have eaten and drunk in thy presence, and thou hast taught in our streets.
Wolaitta Sentences: "He wode intte, Nuuni nenaara miida; uyida; neeni nu biittan tamaarissadasa yaagana.

English Sentences: But he shall say, I tell you, I know you not whence ye are; depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yaagin I qassi, Taani inttessi odais; intte awappe yiyaakko, taani inttena erikke; makkalati ubbaikka ta matappe haakkite yaagana.

English Sentences: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when ye shall see Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and all the prophets, in the kingdom of God, and you yourselves thrust out.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Abrahaami, Yisaaqi, Yaaqoobinne hananabaa yootiyaageeti ubbai karen intte eqqidaashin, Xoossaa kawotettan de7iyaageeta intte be7iyo wode, intte yeekkananne achchaa garccana.

English Sentences: And they shall come from the east, and from the west, and from the north, and from the south, and shall sit down in the kingdom of God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asai arshshoppenne arggoppe, qassi huuphessa baggappenne tohossa baggappe yiidi, Xoossaa kawotettan qumaa maanau uttana.

English Sentences: And, behold, there are last which shall be first, and there are first which shall be last.
Wolaitta Sentences: Be7ite; ha77i guyyen de7iyaageeti sinttau aadhdhana; ha77i sinttan de7iyaageeti guyye aadhdhana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: The same day there came certain of the Pharisees, saying unto him, Get thee out, and depart hence: for Herod will kill thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode Parisaawetuppe issoi issoi Yesuusakko yiidi, "Heeroodisi nena woranau koyiyo gishshau, hagaappe baichcha" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And he said unto them, Go ye, and tell that fox, Behold, I cast out devils, and I do cures to day and to morrow, and the third day I shall be perfected.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yesuusi zaaridi, "Biidi he worakanaassi, Hachchinne wontto xalaheta kessana; qassi harggida asaakka pattana; yaatada heezzantto gallassi ta oosuwaa wurssana yaagite.

English Sentences: Nevertheless I must walk to day, and to morrow, and the day following: for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin hananabaa yootiyaagee Yerusalaameppe harasan haiqqanau bessenna gishshau, taani hachchi, wonttonne wonttifen ogiyaa bollan de7anau bessees.

English Sentences: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, which killest the prophets, and stonest them that are sent unto thee; how often would I have gathered thy children together, as a hen doth gather her brood under her wings, and ye would not!
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yerusalaame katamaa asau, Yerusalaame katamaa asau, hananabaa yootiyaageeta intte woreeta; Xoossai inttekko kiittidoogeetakka shuchchan caddeeta; kuttiyaa ba marata ba qefiyan haphphiyoogaadan, taani intte naata issi diri shiishshanau aapputoo koyidanaa! SHin tana diggideta.

English Sentences: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate: and verily I say unto you, Ye shall not see me, until the time come when ye shall say, Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord.
Wolaitta Sentences: Be7ite, Xoossai intte keettaa muleera yeggi bayana; taani intteyyo odais; intte, Godaa sunttan yiyaagee anjjettidaagaa gaana gakkanaashin, tana be7ekketa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, as he went into the house of one of the chief Pharisees to eat bread on the sabbath day, that they watched him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi Sambbata gallassi Yesuusi Parisaawetu halaqatuppe issuwaa soo laaxaa maanau biis. He wode eti a daro naagoosona.

English Sentences: And, behold, there was a certain man before him which had the dropsy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bollai kixxido issi bitanee Yesuusa sinttan de7ees.

English Sentences: And Jesus answering spake unto the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath day?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageetanne Parisaaweta, "Nu higgee Sambbatan asa pattanau azaziiyye azazennee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they held their peace. And he took him, and healed him, and let him go;
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin eti co77u giidosona. Yesuusi he bitaniyaa bollaa bochchidi, pattidi yeddiis.

English Sentences: And answered them, saying, Which of you shall have an ass or an ox fallen into a pit, and will not straightway pull him out on the sabbath day?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi eta, "Intteppe Sambbatan ba boorai woi haree ollan kunddin, Sambbata giidi, sohuwaara ollaappe kessenai oonee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they could not answer him again to these things.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin etau ha yohuwaassi zaaruwaa immanau danddayettennan ixxiis.

English Sentences: And he put forth a parable to those which were bidden, when he marked how they chose out the chief rooms; saying unto them,
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi issi imattati bonchcho sohuwaa waatidi dooriyaakko, Yesuusi xeellidi, leemisuwaa odiiddi, hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: When thou art bidden of any man to a wedding, sit not down in the highest room; lest a more honourable man than thou be bidden of him;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Nena asi bullachchaa xeesikko, bonchcho sohuwan uttoppa. Neeppe bonchchettiya asi xeesettidaakkonne ooni erii?

English Sentences: And he that bade thee and him come and say to thee, Give this man place; and thou begin with shame to take the lowest room.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nenanne anne xeesidaagee yiidi nena, Ha sohuwaa ayyo imma yaagin, neeni yeellatada ziqqiyaasan uttana.

English Sentences: But when thou art bidden, go and sit down in the lowest room; that when he that bade thee cometh, he may say unto thee, Friend, go up higher: then shalt thou have worship in the presence of them that sit at meat with thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin nena xeesidaagee yiidi nena, Ta ishau pude aadhdha gaana mala, ubbaappe ziqqiyaasan utta; he wode neeni imatta ubbaa sinttan bonchchettana.

English Sentences: For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, bana xoqqu oottiya urai ziqqi gaana; bana ziqqi oottiya urai xoqqu gaana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then said he also to him that bade him, When thou makest a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends, nor thy brethren, neither thy kinsmen, nor thy rich neighbours; lest they also bid thee again, and a recompence be made thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi bana ba soo xeesida bitaniyaa hagaadan yaagiis; "Neeni laaxaa woi kahuwaa ne son katissiyo wode, ne laggeta woi ne ishantta woi ne dabbota woi ne dure shoorota xeesoppa; aissi giikko, eti nena kayan xeesidi, he kushiyaa neessi zaarana.

English Sentences: But when thou makest a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind:
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin neeni qumaa katissiyo wode, hiyyeesata, quunata, wobbeta, qooqeta xeesa.

English Sentences: And thou shalt be blessed; for they cannot recompense thee: for thou shalt be recompensed at the resurrection of the just.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti ne kushiyaa zaaranau danddayenna gishshau, neeni anjjettana. Xilloti haiquwaappe denddiyo wode ne kushiyaa Xoossai zaarana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these things, he said unto him, Blessed is he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qumaa maanau uttida asaappe issoi hegaa siyidi Yesuusa, "Xoossaa kawotettan qumaa maanau uttanaageeti anjjettidaageeta" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then said he unto him, A certain man made a great supper, and bade many:
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yesuusi zaaridi, hagaadan yaagiis; "Issi bitanee daro qumaa katissidi, daro asaa xeesiis.

English Sentences: And sent his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden, Come; for all things are now ready.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qumaa miyo wodee gakkin, kase xeesetti uttida asaa, Ubbabai ha77i giigi uttido gishshau, haa yiite gaanau, ba ashkkarata asaakko kiittiis.

English Sentences: And they all with one consent began to make excuse. The first said unto him, I have bought a piece of ground, and I must needs go and see it: I pray thee have me excused.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ubbai huuphiyan huuphiyan banttana aggi bayana mala woossidosona. Koiroogee ashkkaraassi yootiiddi, Taani biittaa shammaas; he biittaa baada be7anau koshshees; hayyanaa tana hanqqettoppa yaagiis.

English Sentences: And another said, I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I go to prove them: I pray thee have me excused.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hankkoi, Taani ichchashu waaxa boorata shammidoogeeta goya be7ana bais; hayyanaa tana hanqqettoppa yaagiis.

English Sentences: And another said, I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Harai qassi, Taani machchiyo ekkido gishshau, baanau danddayikke yaagiis.

English Sentences: So that servant came, and shewed his lord these things. Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant, Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in hither the poor, and the maimed, and the halt, and the blind.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ashkkarai simmidi, hegaa godaassi odiis. Odin godai daro hanqqettidi, ba ashkkaraa, Elle katamaa ogiyaanne toho ogiyaa baada, hiyyeesata, quunnida asata, wobbetanne qooqeta ekkada ya yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the servant said, Lord, it is done as thou hast commanded, and yet there is room.
Wolaitta Sentences: "A ashkkarai, Ta godau, neeni azazidoogaadan oottaas; shin ha77ikka sohoi de7ees yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the lord said unto the servant, Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel them to come in, that my house may be filled.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yaagin godai ashkkaraa, Dere garssa ogiyaanne loossuwaa baada, ta keettaa kumana mala, asaa ta soo eha.

English Sentences: For I say unto you, That none of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, kase ta soo xeesettida asatuppe issoinne ta qumaa meennaagaa taani intteyyo odais giis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And there went great multitudes with him: and he turned, and said unto them,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi daro asaara biidi, asaakko guyye simmidi,

English Sentences: If any man come to me, and hate not his father, and mother, and wife, and children, and brethren, and sisters, yea, and his own life also, he cannot be my disciple.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taakko yiya ooninne ba aawaa, ba aayyiyo, ba machchiyo, ba naata, ba ishantta, ba michchentta, harai atto banakka ixxana xayikko, tana kaalliyaagaa gidanau danddayenna.

English Sentences: And whosoever doth not bear his cross, and come after me, cannot be my disciple.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba huuphe masqqaliyaa tookkidi, tana kaallenna urai ta erissiyo ashkkara gidanau danddayenna.

English Sentences: For which of you, intending to build a tower, sitteth not down first, and counteth the cost, whether he have sufficient to finish it?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Intteppe issi urai shuchcha keettaa keexxanau koyikko, keettaa polanau woqqu miishshaa koshshiyaakko, koiroora uttidi qoodennai oonee?

English Sentences: Lest haply, after he hath laid the foundation, and is not able to finish it, all that behold it begin to mock him,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaanana xayikko, keettaa doommidi, i polanau danddayennan aggin, hegaa be7ida asai ubbai,

English Sentences: Saying, This man began to build, and was not able to finish.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha bitanee keexxanau doommidi, polana danddayibeenna yaagidi, a bolli miichchaa doommees.

English Sentences: Or what king, going to make war against another king, sitteth not down first, and consulteth whether he be able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Woi tammu sha7u asai de7iyo kawoi laatamu sha7u asai de7iyo kawuwaara olettanau danddayiyaakkonne, koiroora uttidi qoppennee? Qoppana xayikko, hegee yaatin aiba kawoo?

English Sentences: Or else, while the other is yet a great way off, he sendeth an ambassage, and desireth conditions of peace.
Wolaitta Sentences: Baassi danddayettana xayikko, hinkko kawoi haahuwan de7ishin sigettanau woossees.

English Sentences: So likewise, whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath, he cannot be my disciple.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadan baassi de7iya ubbabaa aggi bayenna urai tana kaalliyaagaa gidanau danddayenna.

English Sentences: Salt is good: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be seasoned?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Maxinee lo77o; shin laqilaqana xayikko, naa77antto a waatidi laqilaqissanee?

English Sentences: It is neither fit for the land, nor yet for the dunghill; but men cast it out. He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
Wolaitta Sentences: Biittaunne lo77enna; araddissiyaabaanne gidenna. Asai a oli bayees. Siyanau haittai de7iyoogee hegaa siyo" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi gallassi, giiraa shiishshiyaageetinne nagaranchchati Yesuusabaa siyanau daroti akko shiiqidosona.

English Sentences: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, This man receiveth sinners, and eateth with them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Parisaawetinne higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageeti, "Hagee nagaranchchatuura dabbotees; etaara mees" yaagidi, Yesuusa bolli zuuzummidosona.

English Sentences: And he spake this parable unto them, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: Zuuzummin Yesuusi etassi ha leemisuwaa odiiddi,

English Sentences: What man of you, having an hundred sheep, if he lose one of them, doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness, and go after that which is lost, until he find it?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Intteppe issi uraassi xeetu dorssi de7iyoogee etappe issinna geelladan bayiyaabaa gidikko, uddufun tammanne uddufunaa buuran yeggi bayidi, issinno demmana gakkanaashin koyanau beennee?

English Sentences: And when he hath found it, he layeth it on his shoulders, rejoicing.
Wolaitta Sentences: He bayida dorssiyo demmido wode ufaittidi, ba hashiyan tookkees.

English Sentences: And when he cometh home, he calleth together his friends and neighbours, saying unto them, Rejoice with me; for I have found my sheep which was lost.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tookkidi soo ehiidi, ba laggetanne ba shoorota issippe xeesees; xeesidi, Taani ta bayida dorssiyo demmido gishshau, tanaara ufaittite yaagidi, etassi odees.

English Sentences: I say unto you, that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth, more than over ninety and nine just persons, which need no repentance.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani intteyyo odiyoogee aibee giikko, hegaadan nagaraappe simmana koshshenna uddufun tammanne uddufun xillotun ufaittanaappe ba nagaraappe simmiya issi nagaranchchan saluwan de7iyaageeti ufaittana.

English Sentences: Either what woman having ten pieces of silver, if she lose one piece, doth not light a candle, and sweep the house, and seek diligently till she find it?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Woikko tammu bootta shilinggee de7iyoora geelladan, issi shilinggee bayikko, xomppiyaa xomppada, ba keettaa pittada demmana gakkanaashin, minttada koyennaara oonee?

English Sentences: And when she hath found it, she calleth her friends and her neighbours together, saying, Rejoice with me; for I have found the piece which I had lost.
Wolaitta Sentences: Demmido wode, a ba laggetanne ba shoorota issippe xeesada, Taani ta bayida shilinggiyaa demmido gishshau, tanaara ufaittite yaagana.

English Sentences: Likewise, I say unto you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani inttessi odais; hegaadan Xoossaa kiitanchchati nagaraappe simmiya issi nagaranchchan ufaittana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said, A certain man had two sons:
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassikka Yesuusi hagaadan yaagiis; "Issi bitaniyaassi naa77u naati de7oosona.

English Sentences: And the younger of them said to his father, Father, give me the portion of goods that falleth to me. And he divided unto them his living.
Wolaitta Sentences: Etappe kaaloi ba aawaa, Ta aawau, neessi de7iyaabaappe tana gakkiyaagaa shaakkada hamma yaagin, aawai baassi de7iyaabaa ba naa77u naatussi shaakkiis.

English Sentences: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together, and took his journey into a far country, and there wasted his substance with riotous living.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Guutta gallassaappe guyyiyan, kaalo na7ai ba miishshaa ubbaa shiishshi ekkidi, haaho dere biis. Hegan miishshaa ohettaa mooridi, ba miishshaa laaliis.

English Sentences: And when he had spent all, there arose a mighty famine in that land; and he began to be in want.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ayyo de7iyaabai ubbai wuriichchidoogaappe guyyiyan, he biittan wolqqaama koshai gelin, i tuggatiis.

English Sentences: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.
Wolaitta Sentences: He dere asaappe issuwaakko biidi, Tana neessi ashkkara oottarkkii? yaagin, bitanee ba gudunttaa wudiyaa heemmanau dembbaa a yeddiis.

English Sentences: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat: and no man gave unto him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gudunttaa wudee miyo harqquwaa maanaukka amottiis; shin ayyo ainne immidai baawa.

English Sentences: And when he came to himself, he said, How many hired servants of my father's have bread enough and to spare, and I perish with hunger!
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ba mooruwaa hassayidi, Qumai xoonidi sa7an attiyo ta aawaa oosanchchati aappuna shin, tana hagan namisai worii?

English Sentences: I will arise and go to my father, and will say unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and before thee,
Wolaitta Sentences: Denddada ta aawaakko baada, "Ta aawau, taani Xoossaakka nenakka naaqqaas.

English Sentences: And am no more worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hagaappe sinttan ne na7a geetettanaukka bessikke; tana ne ashkkaratuppe issuwaadan wottarkkii" gaana

English Sentences: And he arose, and came to his father. But when he was yet a great way off, his father saw him, and had compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.
Wolaitta Sentences: yaagidi denddidi, ba aawaakko yiis. "I biron haahuwan de7ishin, a aawai a be7idi, ayyo mishettiis; woxxi qoommidi, a yeriis.

English Sentences: And the son said unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in thy sight, and am no more worthy to be called thy son.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Na7ai, Ta aawau, taani Xoossaakka nenakka naaqqaas; hagaappe sinttan ne na7a geetettanaukka bessikke yaagiis.

English Sentences: But the father said to his servants, Bring forth the best robe, and put it on him; and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet:
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHin a aawai ba ashkkarata hagaadan yaagiis; Ubbaappe lo77iya maayuwaa eesuwan ehiidi, a maizzite; a kushiyan migiduwaa a gediyankka caammaa wottite.

English Sentences: And bring hither the fatted calf, and kill it; and let us eat, and be merry:
Wolaitta Sentences: Modhdho mirgguwaa ehiidi shukkite; moos, ufaittoos.

English Sentences: For this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found. And they began to be merry.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, hagee ta na7ai haiqqiis; shin paxiis; qassi bayiis; shin beettiis yaagin, ufaissaa doommidosona.

English Sentences: Now his elder son was in the field: and as he came and drew nigh to the house, he heard musick and dancing.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Baira na7ai gaden de7iyaagee yiidi, soo matiyo wode, karaabiyaanne yettaa siyiis.

English Sentences: And he called one of the servants, and asked what these things meant.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ashkkaratuppe issuwaa xeesidi, Hegee aibee? yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: And he said unto him, Thy brother is come; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf, because he hath received him safe and sound.
Wolaitta Sentences: Oichchin ashkkarai, Ne ishai saro yiido gishshau, ne aawai modhdho mirgguwaa ayyo shukissiis yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he was angry, and would not go in: therefore came his father out, and intreated him.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Baira na7ai hanqqettidi, soo gelennan ixxin, a aawai kare kiyidi, a woossiis.

English Sentences: And he answering said to his father, Lo, these many years do I serve thee, neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment: and yet thou never gavest me a kid, that I might make merry with my friends:
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin i ba aawaa hagaadan yaagiis; Hagaa keena laittaa neessi daro oottaas; neeni giidobaa polennan mulekka aggabeikke; ta laggetuura ufaittana mala, taassi harai atto issi deeshsha marakka imma erakka.

English Sentences: But as soon as this thy son was come, which hath devoured thy living with harlots, thou hast killed for him the fatted calf.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin hagee ne na7ai, ne miishshaa shaaramuxa maccaasan wurssidaagee yin, ayyo modhdho mirgguwaa shukkadasa yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said unto him, Son, thou art ever with me, and all that I have is thine.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yaagin aawai a, Ta na7au, neeni ubba wode tanaara de7aasa; tabai ubbaikka neessa.

English Sentences: It was meet that we should make merry, and be glad: for this thy brother was dead, and is alive again; and was lost, and is found.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin hagee ne ishai, haiqqidaagee paxido gishshaunne bayidaagee beettido gishshau, nuuni miiddi uyiiddi ufaittana koshshees yaagiis" giidi Yesuusi yootiis.

English Sentences: And he said also unto his disciples, There was a certain rich man, which had a steward; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi ba erissiyo ashkkaratussi yootiiddi, "Issi dure bitanee de7ees; baappe garssaara i sunttido bitanee de7iyaagee a miishshaa mooriis giyo zigirssai a gakkiis.

English Sentences: And he called him, and said unto him, How is it that I hear this of thee? give an account of thy stewardship; for thou mayest be no longer steward.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba sunttido bitaniyaa xeesidi, Ha nena asai giyoogee aibee? Hagaappe sinttan neeni taappe garssaara suntta gidanau danddayenna gishshau, ne kushiyan de7iya ta miishsha ubbaa hamma yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then the steward said within himself, What shall I do? for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship: I cannot dig; to beg I am ashamed.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yaagin bitanee, Ta godai tana oosuwaappe kessana hanees. SHin hai waanoo? Taassi hem77anau wolqqi baawa; woossanau taassi pokkees.

English Sentences: I am resolved what to do, that, when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta oottanabaa ta erais; i tana ta oosuwaappe kessiyo wode, bantta soo bin, tana mokkiya laggeta taani demmana yaagiis.

English Sentences: So he called every one of his lord's debtors unto him, and said unto the first, How much owest thou unto my lord?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ba godaappe miishshaa tal77ida asata huuphiyan huuphiyan xeesidi, koiro bitaniyaa, Neeni ta godaappe ai tal77adii? yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said, An hundred measures of oil. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and sit down quickly, and write fifty.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani xeetu baattaa kumida zaitiyaa tal77aas yaagiis. "Yaagin, Ne paramaa hei; uttada eesuwan ishatama gaada xaafa yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then said he to another, And how much owest thou? And he said, An hundred measures of wheat. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and write fourscore.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Guyyeppe hankkuwaa Ne acoi aappunee? yaagiis. "Xeetu qun77a gistte yaagiis."Yaagin, Ne paramaa hei; hosppun tamma gaada xaafa yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the lord commended the unjust steward, because he had done wisely: for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light.
Wolaitta Sentences: "He sunttai cinccatettan oottido gishshau, a godai a galatiis; aissi giikko, ha sa7aa asai babau poo7uwaa asaappe aadhdhida cincca.

English Sentences: And I say unto you, Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness; that, when ye fail, they may receive you into everlasting habitations.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani intteyyo odais; worddo miishshai wuriyo wode, merinau wurenna keettan inttena eti mokkana mala, he miishshan intte huuphessi lagge demmite.

English Sentences: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much: and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daro guuttaban ammanettiya urai qassi gitaban ammanettees. Daro guuttaban ammanettenna urai gitabankka ammanettenna.

English Sentences: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin intte ha sa7aa miishshan ammanettennabaa gidikko, tumu miishshaa inttessi asi waatidi hadara yaagidi immanee?

English Sentences: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man's, who shall give you that which is your own?
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte hara asa miishshaa bashshiyaabaa gidikko, intteegaa oonee intteyyo immanai?

English Sentences: No servant can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Naa77u godatuyyo haarettanau danddayiya ashkkari baawa; aissi giikko, woi issuwaa ixxidi, hinkkuwaa siiqana; woi issuwaa bonchchidi, hinkkuwaa karana; Xoossaassinne miishshaassi haarettanau danddayekketa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the Pharisees also, who were covetous, heard all these things: and they derided him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Miishsha dosiya Parisaaweti hegaa ubbaa siyidi, Yesuusa bolli qilliiccidosona.

English Sentences: And he said unto them, Ye are they which justify yourselves before men; but God knoweth your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yesuusi eta, "Intte asaa sinttan intte huuphiyaa xillissiyaageeta; shin intte wozanaa Xoossai erees; aissi giikko, asa sinttan bonchchettiyaagee Xoossaa sinttan tuna gidees.

English Sentences: The law and the prophets were until John: since that time the kingdom of God is preached, and every man presseth into it.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Muuse higgeenne hananabaa yootiyaageeti xaafido maxaafai Yohaannisa wodiyaa gakkanaashin de7idosona; he wodiyaappe doommin, Xoossaa kawotettai odettiis; ubbai yaa gelanau warettees.

English Sentences: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass, than one tittle of the law to fail.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin higgiyaappe issi qaaliyaa moorettanaappe saloinne sa7ai aadhdhiyoogee matattees.

English Sentences: Whosoever putteth away his wife, and marrieth another, committeth adultery: and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from her husband committeth adultery.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ba machchiyo yeddidi, haranno ekkiya ooninne shaaramuxees; qassi azinai yeddido maccaasiyo ekkiya ooninne shaaramuxees.

English Sentences: There was a certain rich man, which was clothed in purple and fine linen, and fared sumptuously every day:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Daro al77o maayuwaa maayiya issi dure bitanee de7ees. Ayyo sa7ai lo77in, ubba gallassi ufaittidi de7ees.

English Sentences: And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, which was laid at his gate, full of sores,
Wolaitta Sentences: Al77aazara giyo masunxxida issi hiyyeesai, dure bitanee miyo masoofiyaappe sa7an wodhdhiya suuppa qumaa maanau amottidi, duriyaa penggen zin77ees.

English Sentences: And desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man's table: moreover the dogs came and licked his sores.
Wolaitta Sentences: Harai atto kanatikka yiidi, a masunttaa laaccoosona.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, that the beggar died, and was carried by the angels into Abraham's bosom: the rich man also died, and was buried;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hiyyeesa bitanee haiqqin, kiitanchchati a tookkidi, Abrahaama baggi aattidosona. Qassi dure bitanee haiqqidi moogettiis.

English Sentences: And in hell he lift up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.
Wolaitta Sentences: Si7ooliyan daro seelettiiddi, haahuwan de7iya Abrahaama xoqqu giidi xeelliis. Qassi Al77aazarakka Abrahaama matan de7iyaagaa be7iis.

English Sentences: And he cried and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue; for I am tormented in this flame.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ba qaalaa xoqqu oottidi, Ta aawau Abrahaamaa, tana maara. Taani ha tamaa lacuwan paxa kaa7ettiyo gishshau, ba kushiyaa biradhdhiyaa xeeraa haattan yeddidi, yiidi ta inxxarssaa irxxissanau Al77aazara taakko yeddarkkii yaagiis.

English Sentences: But Abraham said, Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things, and likewise Lazarus evil things: but now he is comforted, and thou art tormented.
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHin Abrahaami yaagiis; Ta na7au, neeni ne de7uwaa wodiyan lo77obaa ekkin, Al77aazari iitabaa ekkidoogaa hassaya; shin ha77i i hagan ufaittiyo wode, neeni paxa kaa7ettaasa.

English Sentences: And beside all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed: so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot; neither can they pass to us, that would come from thence.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa bolli qassi hagaa baggaara de7iyaageetussi intte baggi pinnanau danddayettenna mala, qassi yaara de7iyaageetikka haa pinnanau danddayenna mala, nu giddooninne intte giddon gita aafoi merettiis yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then he said, I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest send him to my father's house:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yaagin dure bitanee, Ta aawau, yaatikko, neeni Al77aazara ta aawaa soo yeddana mala, nena woossais.

English Sentences: For I have five brethren; that he may testify unto them, lest they also come into this place of torment.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, taassi ichchashu ishantti de7oosona. Eti qassi ha meto sohuwaa yeenna mala, etau Al77aazari biidi markkatto yaagiis.

English Sentences: Abraham saith unto him, They have Moses and the prophets; let them hear them.
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHin Abrahaami, Muuseenne hananabaa yootiyaageeti xaafido maxaafai etau de7ees; he maxaafai giyoogaa eti siyona yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said, Nay, father Abraham: but if one went unto them from the dead, they will repent.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Dure bitanee, CHii, ta aawau Abrahaamaa, hegaa gidenna; shin issi urai haiquwaappe denddidi, etakko biikko, eti bantta nagaraappe simmana yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said unto him, If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded, though one rose from the dead.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Abrahaami, Eti Muuseenne hananabaa yootiyaageeti xaafido maxaafaappe siyana xayikko, harai atto haiquwaappe issi urai denddikkokka ammanokkona giis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then said he unto the disciples, It is impossible but that offences will come: but woe unto him, through whom they come!
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi ba erissiyo ashkkarata hagaadan yaagiis; "Asa balettiyaabai yeennan attenna; shin he balettiyaabaa ehiya uraassi aayye7ana.

English Sentences: It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he cast into the sea, than that he should offend one of these little ones.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha guutta naatuppe issuwaa balettiyoogaappe gaacciyo woxaa ba qooriyan qachchidi, abban mitettiyoogee au keha.

English Sentences: Take heed to yourselves: If thy brother trespass against thee, rebuke him; and if he repent, forgive him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte huuphiyaassi naagettite. "Ne ishai nena naaqqikko, a zora. Qassi nagaraappe i simmikko, ayyo atto ga.

English Sentences: And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day, and seven times in a day turn again to thee, saying, I repent; thou shalt forgive him.
Wolaitta Sentences: I issi gallassi nena laappuntto naaqqidi, he gallassi laappuntto, Taani nagaraappe simmaas yaagiiddi neekko yiikkokka, ayyo atto ga" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the apostles said unto the Lord, Increase our faith.
Wolaitta Sentences: Godai kiittidoogeeti, "Nuussi ammanuwaa gujja" yaagidi Godaa oichchidosona.

English Sentences: And the Lord said, If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye might say unto this sycamine tree, Be thou plucked up by the root, and be thou planted in the sea; and it should obey you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Godai zaaridi, "Inttessi sanaafici giyo qii mittee aifiyo gakkiya ammanoi de7idaakko, intte ha ettaa, Ettau, neeni shodettada abban toketta yaagana; ha ettaikka qassi inttessi azazettana.

English Sentences: But which of you, having a servant plowing or feeding cattle, will say unto him by and by, when he is come from the field, Go and sit down to meat?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Intte giddon goyiya woi miizza heemmiya ashkkari de7iyo asi geella de7ikko, ba ashkkarai oottidi simmidaagaa, Qumaa maanau shiiqa utta gii?

English Sentences: And will not rather say unto him, Make ready wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself, and serve me, till I have eaten and drunken; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink?
Wolaitta Sentences: Gaana xayikko, Taani maana kahuwaa giigissa; ne afalaa laammada, taani miishiininne uyishin, taassi kiitetta. Guyyeppe neessi ma, uya yaagennee?

English Sentences: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him? I trow not.
Wolaitta Sentences: I ba azazuwaa polido gishshau, ba ashkkaraa galatii?

English Sentences: So likewise ye, when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you, say, We are unprofitable servants: we have done that which was our duty to do.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadan inttekka azazettido ubbabaa oottido wode, Nuuni pattenna aille; nu ooso xalaalaa oottida yaagite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, as he went to Jerusalem, that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi Yerusalaame biiddi, Galiilappenne Samaariyaappe gidduwaara aadhdhiis.

English Sentences: And as he entered into a certain village, there met him ten men that were lepers, which stood afar off:
Wolaitta Sentences: I issi qeeri katamiyo geliyo wode, inchchirichchai oiqqido tammu asati haahuwan eqqidaageeta be7iis.

English Sentences: And they lifted up their voices, and said, Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti bantta qaalaa xoqqu oottidi, "Godaa Yesuusaa, hai nuna maararkkii!" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And when he saw them, he said unto them, Go shew yourselves unto the priests. And it came to pass, that, as they went, they were cleansed.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yesuusi eta be7idi, "Biidi, intte bollaa qeeseta bessite" yaagiis. Yaagin biiddi, ogiyan inchchirichchaappe paxidosona.

English Sentences: And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, and with a loud voice glorified God,
Wolaitta Sentences: Etappe issoi bau paxidoogaa be7idi, ba qaalaa xoqqu oottidi, Xoossaa galatiiddi simmiis.

English Sentences: And fell down on his face at his feet, giving him thanks: and he was a Samaritan.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi Yesuusa galatiiddi, a tohuwan kunddiis. Bitanee Samaariyaa asa.

English Sentences: And Jesus answering said, Were there not ten cleansed? but where are the nine?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi zaaridi, "Inchchirichchaappe paxidaageeti tamma gidokkonaa? Yaatin uddufunati awan de7iyoonaa?

English Sentences: There are not found that returned to give glory to God, save this stranger.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha hara dere bitaniyaappe harai Xoossaa galatanau simmidai baawee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said unto him, Arise, go thy way: thy faith hath made thee whole.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi a, "Denddada ba; nena ne ammanoi pattiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees, when the kingdom of God should come, he answered them and said, The kingdom of God cometh not with observation:
Wolaitta Sentences: Parisaaweti, "Xoossaa kawotettai aude yaanee?" yaagidi Yesuusa oichchidosona. Oichchin Yesuusi, "Xoossaa kawotettai beettiya malaataara yeenna.

English Sentences: Neither shall they say, Lo here! or, lo there! for, behold, the kingdom of God is within you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi Xoossaa kawotettai intte giddon de7iyo gishshau, ooninne a hageeho, hagan de7ees; woi hegan de7ees geenna" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said unto the disciples, The days will come, when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man, and ye shall not see it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi erissiyo ashkkaratussi odiiddi, hagaadan yaagiis; "Asa Na7ai beettana gallassatuppe issuwaa intte amottana; shin be7ekketa.

English Sentences: And they shall say to you, See here; or, see there: go not after them, nor follow them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi eti inttena, Hagan xeellite woi Hegan xeellite yaagana. SHin eta kaallidi, etaara booppite.

English Sentences: For as the lightning, that lighteneth out of the one part under heaven, shineth unto the other part under heaven; so shall also the Son of man be in his day.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wolqqanttai wolqqammidi, saluwan ha gaxaappe ya gaxaa gakkidi poo7issiyoogaadan, Asa Na7ai ba gallassi hegaadan hanana.

English Sentences: But first must he suffer many things, and be rejected of this generation.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin koiroora i daro waayiyaa ekkanaunne ha wodiyaa asan ixettanau bessees.

English Sentences: And as it was in the days of Noe, so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta yuussai, Asa Na7aa yuussai, Nohe wodiyan hanidoogaadan, hegaadankka hanana.

English Sentences: They did eat, they drank, they married wives, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nohee markkabiyan gelido gallassai gakkanaashin, asai meesinne uyees, qassi attumaasai machcheesinne maccaasai azinaa gelees; bashshiya haattai yiidi, asa ubbaa woriis.

English Sentences: Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot; they did eat, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they builded;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Qassi Looxe wode hanidoogaadankka hegaadan hanana; eti moosona, uyoosona, shammoosona, baizzoosona, kattaa zeroosona, keettaakka keexxoosona.

English Sentences: But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed them all.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Looxee Sadoomappe kiyido gallassi, Xoossai saluwaappe tamaanne eexxiya shuchchaa bukissidi, ubba asaa wurssiis.

English Sentences: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Asa Na7ai qoncciyan beettiyo gallassi hegaadan hanana.

English Sentences: In that day, he which shall be upon the housetop, and his stuff in the house, let him not come down to take it away: and he that is in the field, let him likewise not return back.
Wolaitta Sentences: He gallassi keettaa huuphiyan de7iyaagee ba son de7iya miishshaa ekkanau wodhdhoppo; hegaadan goshshan de7iyaageekka guyye simmoppo.

English Sentences: Remember Lot's wife.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ane Looxe machcheebaa qoppite!

English Sentences: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba shemppuwaa ashshana koyiya ubbai bashshana; shin ba shemppuwaa bashshiya ubbai ashshana.

English Sentences: I tell you, in that night there shall be two men in one bed; the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani intteyyo odiyoogee aibee giikko, he gallassa qammi naa77u asati issi hiixan zin77ana; etappe issuwaa efin, issoi attana.

English Sentences: Two women shall be grinding together; the one shall be taken, and the other left.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naa77u maccaasati issi sohuwan gaacciyaageetuppe issinniyo efin, issinniyaa attana.

English Sentences: Two men shall be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naa77u asati gaden oottiyaageetuppe issuwaa efaana; issoi attana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they answered and said unto him, Where, Lord? And he said unto them, Wheresoever the body is, thither will the eagles be gathered together.
Wolaitta Sentences: Erissiyo ashkkarati qassi a, "Godau, hegee awan hananee?" yaagidosona. Yaagin Yesuusi, "Gauxai de7iyoosaa ankkoi shiiqana" yaagidi, etassi odiis.

English Sentences: And he spake a parable unto them to this end, that men ought always to pray, and not to faint;
Wolaitta Sentences: Erissiyo ashkkarati ubba gallassi salettennan woossana mala, Yesuusi etassi leemisuwaa odiiddi,

English Sentences: Saying, There was in a city a judge, which feared not God, neither regarded man:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Issi kataman Xoossaassi yayyenna qassi asassikka yeellatenna issi daannai de7ees.

English Sentences: And there was a widow in that city; and she came unto him, saying, Avenge me of mine adversary.
Wolaitta Sentences: He kataman issi am77e maccaasiyaa de7iyaara he daannaakko ya yaada, Taaninne ta baarigaarai mootettiyo yohuwaa taassi pirdda yaagausu.

English Sentences: And he would not for a while: but afterward he said within himself, Though I fear not God, nor regard man;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Daannai daro wodiyaasappe iyyo pirddennan ixxiis; shin ba wozanan qoppiiddi, Taani Xoossaassi yayyennan woi asassi yeellatennan ixxikkonne,

English Sentences: Yet because this widow troubleth me, I will avenge her, lest by her continual coming she weary me.
Wolaitta Sentences: ha am77e maccaasiyaa tana waissiyo gishshau, qassi ubba wode ya yaada tana daafurssenna mala, iyyo pirddana giis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the Lord said, Hear what the unjust judge saith.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassikka Godai, "He makkala daannai giidoogaa siyite.

English Sentences: And shall not God avenge his own elect, which cry day and night unto him, though he bear long with them?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin bana maaddana mala, gallassinne qammi baakko waassiya doorettida asaassi Xoossai pirddennee? I etassi eesuwan zaarennee?

English Sentences: I tell you that he will avenge them speedily. Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh, shall he find faith on the earth?
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani inttessi odiyoogee aibee giikko, i eesuwan etassi pirddana; shin Asa Na7ai yiyo wode, ha sa7an ammano demmanee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and despised others:
Wolaitta Sentences: Banttana xillo giidi, hara asa ubbaa kariyaageetussi Yesuusi issi leemisuwaa odiiddi, hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: Two men went up into the temple to pray; the one a Pharisee, and the other a publican.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Naa77u asati Xoossaa woossanau Beeta Maqidasiyaa kiyidosona; etappe issoi Parisaawe, issoi giiraa shiishshiyaagaa.

English Sentences: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself, God, I thank thee, that I am not as other men are, extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this publican.
Wolaitta Sentences: Parisaawee eqqidi, ba wozana giddon woossiiddi, Xoossau, taani hara asa ubbaadan, worddanchcha, uuzenne shaaramuxa woi ha giiraa shiishshiyaagaa mala gidenna gishshau, nena galatais.

English Sentences: I fast twice in the week, I give tithes of all that I possess.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saaminttan saaminttan naa77utoo xoomais; taani demmiyo miishsha ubbaappe asirataa immais yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the publican, standing afar off, would not lift up so much as his eyes unto heaven, but smote upon his breast, saying, God be merciful to me a sinner.
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHin giiraa shiishshiyaagee haahuwan eqqidi, harai atto saluwaa xeellanaukka dosibeenna. SHin, Xoossau, taani nagaranchcha; tana maara yaagidi, ba tiraa bubbuxiis.

English Sentences: I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other: for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani inttessi odiyoogee aibee giikko, hagee Parisaawiyaappe xillidi, ba soo biis. Aissi giikko, bana xoqqu oottiya urai kauyyana; shin bana kaushshiya urai xoqqu gaana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they brought unto him also infants, that he would touch them: but when his disciples saw it, they rebuked them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi guutta naata bochchana mala, issi issi asai naata akko ehiis; shin erissiyo ashkkarati hegaa be7idi, he asaa hanqqettidosona.

English Sentences: But Jesus called them unto him, and said, Suffer little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi guutta naata baakko xeesidi, "Guutta naati taakko yiyoogaa diggoppite; aissi giikko, Xoossaa kawotettai hageetu malaassa.

English Sentences: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani intteyyo tumaa gais; Xoossaa kawotettaa guutta na7adan ekkenna urai ooninne he kawotettaa mulekka gelenna" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yihudaa biittaa haariyaageetuppe issoi, "Lo77o tamaarissiyaagoo, taani merinaa de7uwaa laattanau ai oottoo?" yaagidi Yesuusa oichchiis.

English Sentences: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? none is good, save one, that is, God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi zaaridi, "Tana aissi lo77o gai? Xoossaa xalaalaappe attin, hara lo77oi ooninne baawa;

English Sentences: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Honour thy father and thy mother.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa azazuwaa, SHaaramuxoppa; woroppa; wuuqqoppa; wordduwaa markkattoppa; ne aawaanne ne aayyiyo bonchcha yaagiyaagaa eraasa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said, All these have I kept from my youth up.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bitanee, "Taani hegaa ubbaa naatettaasappe doommada ha77i gakkanaassikka naagais" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Now when Jesus heard these things, he said unto him, Yet lackest thou one thing: sell all that thou hast, and distribute unto the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi hegaa siyidi bitaniyaa, "Ha77ikka neeyyo issibai paccees; neeyyo de7iyaabaa ubbaa baizzada he miishshaa hiyyeesau gisha; neeni saluwan duretana; yaatada yaada tana kaalla" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when he heard this, he was very sorrowful: for he was very rich.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin bitanee hegaa siyido wode, i daro dure gidiyo gishshau qarettiis.

English Sentences: And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful, he said, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!
Wolaitta Sentences: Bitanee daro qarettidoogaa Yesuusi be7idi, "Dure asi Xoossaa kawotettaa gelanaagee waani metanddeeshsha!

English Sentences: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle's eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dure asi Xoossaa kawotettaa gelanaagaappe gaameelai marppiyaa xoo7iyaara aadhdhanaagee matattees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they that heard it said, Who then can be saved?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa siyidaageeti, "Yaatin attanau danddayiyai oonee?" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And he said, The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yesuusi zaaridi, "Asau danddayettennabai Xoossau danddayettees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Peter said, Lo, we have left all, and followed thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: PHeexiroosi Yesuusa, "Be7a; nuuni nuussi de7iya ubbabaa aggi bayidi, nena kaallida" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or parents, or brethren, or wife, or children, for the kingdom of God's sake,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi, "Taani inttessi tumaa gais; Xoossaa kawotettaa gishshau giiddi, keettaa woi aawaanne aayyiyo, woi ishantta, woi machchiyo, woi naata aggida asi ooninne ha77i baassi de7iyaagaappe daruwaa ekkana; q

English Sentences: Who shall not receive manifold more in this present time, and in the world to come life everlasting.
Wolaitta Sentences: assi sinttappe yaana wodiyankka merinaa de7uwaa ekkana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then he took unto him the twelve, and said unto them, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi tammanne naa77u erissiyo ashkkarata banaara efiiddi eta, "Nuuni ha77i Yerusalaame kiyeettees; hananabaa yootiyaageeti xaafido tabai, Asa Na7aabai, ubbai polettana.

English Sentences: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles, and shall be mocked, and spitefully entreated, and spitted on:
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, eti tana Aihuda gidenna asaassi aattidi immana; ta bolli qilliiccana; cuchchana; qassi tana waissana;

English Sentences: And they shall scourge him, and put him to death: and the third day he shall rise again.
Wolaitta Sentences: eti tana lissuwan garafananne worana; shin taani heezzantto gallassi haiquwaappe denddana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they understood none of these things: and this saying was hid from them, neither knew they the things which were spoken.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin erissiyo ashkkaratussi i yootidobaappe aibinne gelibeenna; i yootidobai etappe geemmin, eranau danddayibookkona.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, that as he was come nigh unto Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the way side begging:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi Yarkko gakkana matidaashin, issi qooqe bitanee woossiiddi, ogiyaa doonan uttiis.

English Sentences: And hearing the multitude pass by, he asked what it meant.
Wolaitta Sentences: Uttidaagee daro asai aadhdhiyoogaa siyidi, "Hegee aibee?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: And they told him, that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asai, "Naazireeta Yesuusi aadhdhees" yaagidi ayyo yootiis.

English Sentences: And he cried, saying, Jesus, thou son of David, have mercy on me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yootin ba qaalaa xoqqu oottidi, "Daawita na7au, Yesuusaa, tana maararkkii!" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they which went before rebuked him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried so much the more, Thou son of David, have mercy on me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sinttan de7iyaageeti a, "Haizza!" giidi hanqqettidosona; shin i ba qaalaa kaseegaappekka keehi xoqqu oottidi, "Daawita na7au, tana maararkkii!" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jesus stood, and commanded him to be brought unto him: and when he was come near, he asked him,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi eqqidi, he qooqe bitaniyaa baakko ehaana mala azaziis. Qooqee akko yiidi gakkana matishin,

English Sentences: Saying, What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee? And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani neeyyo ai oottanau koyai?" yaagidi a oichchiis. Oichchin qooqee, "Ta Godau, taani xeellanaagaa koyais" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jesus said unto him, Receive thy sight: thy faith hath saved thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yesuusi a, "Xeella; nena ne ammanoi pattiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And immediately he received his sight, and followed him, glorifying God: and all the people, when they saw it, gave praise unto God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sohuwaarakka a aifee xeelli aggin, Xoossaa galatiiddi, Yesuusa kaalli bayiis. Asa ubbai hegaa be7idi, Xoossaa galatiis.

English Sentences: And Jesus entered and passed through Jericho.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi Yarkko giyo katamaara aadhdhees.

English Sentences: And, behold, there was a man named Zacchaeus, which was the chief among the publicans, and he was rich.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegan Zakkiyoosa giyo giiraa shiishshiyaageetu alaafee de7ees; i dure asa.

English Sentences: And he sought to see Jesus who he was; and could not for the press, because he was little of stature.
Wolaitta Sentences: Zakkiyoosi Yesuusi oonakko be7anau koyiis; shin i qantta gidido gishshaunne asai daro gidido gishshau, be7anau danddayibeenna.

English Sentences: And he ran before, and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him: for he was to pass that way.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi hegaara aadhdhiyo gishshau, asaappe sinttau woxxidi, Yesuusa be7anau issi ettaa xeeraa kiyiis.

English Sentences: And when Jesus came to the place, he looked up, and saw him, and said unto him, Zacchaeus, make haste, and come down; for to day I must abide at thy house.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi he sohuwaa gakkiiddi, pude xeellidi, "Zakkiyoosaa, taani hachchi ne son pe7anau bessiyo gishshau, eesuwan wodhdha" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he made haste, and came down, and received him joyfully.
Wolaitta Sentences: Zakkiyoosi eesuwan ettaappe wodhdhidi, ufaissan Yesuusa mokkiis.

English Sentences: And when they saw it, they all murmured, saying, That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa be7ida asai ubbai, "Hagee nagaranchchaa son imatettanau geliis" yaagidi zuuzummiis.

English Sentences: And Zacchaeus stood, and said unto the Lord; Behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation, I restore him fourfold.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Zakkiyoosi eqqidi Godaa, "Ta Godau, taani taassi de7iya ubbabaappe baggaa hiyyeesau immana; qassi ooppenne wordduwan ekkidobaa gidikko, i bashshido mehiyaassi oiddu kushiyaa ayyo zaarana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jesus said unto him, This day is salvation come to this house, forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi Zakkiyoosassi yootiiddi, "Neenikka Abrahaama zeretta gidiyo gishshau, atotettai hachchi ha keettaa yiis.

English Sentences: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, taani, Asa Na7ai, bayidaagaa koyanaunne ashshanau yaas" yaagiis.
